info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 5:57PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mineral, west central Missoula and southeastern Sanders Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 557 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Riverbend, or near Superior, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Superior, Riverbend, Tarkio, Keystone, Quartz and Lozeau. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 43 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
